p: Taxa abundance differed among the three type of communities ( Figure 3). For instance, Proteobacteria abundance was significantly higher in the rhizosphere than in soil, 37.9% and 29.2%, respectively (KW FDR, p < 0.001), whereas Chloroflexi, Acidobacteria and Planctomyces were more abundant in soil (KW FDR, p < 0.001) than rhizosphere. The most dominant taxa in the endosphere was Proteobacteria and this phylum was more represented in LE sites compared to HE sites, comprising 91.3% of the ASV and 79.3%, respectively.
